easy.airplane: an aircraft that has a fixed wing and is powered by propellers or jets
easy.ant: social insect living in organized colonies; characteristically the males and fertile queen have wings during breeding season; wingless sterile females are the workers
easy.anvil: a heavy block of iron or steel on which hot metals are shaped by hammering
easy.apple: fruit with red or yellow or green skin and sweet to tart crisp whitish flesh
easy.axe: an edge tool with a heavy bladed head mounted across a handle
easy.backpack: a bag carried by a strap on your back or shoulder
easy.banana: elongated crescent-shaped yellow fruit with soft sweet flesh
easy.bed: a piece of furniture that provides a place to sleep
easy.bee: any of numerous hairy-bodied insects including social and solitary species
easy.belt: a band to tie or buckle around the body (usually at the waist)
easy.bench: a long seat for more than one person
easy.bicycle: a wheeled vehicle that has two wheels and is moved by foot pedals
easy.binoculars: an optical instrument designed for simultaneous use by both eyes
easy.bird: warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrates characterized by feathers and forelimbs modified as wings
easy.book: physical objects consisting of a number of pages bound together
easy.boomerang: a curved piece of wood; when properly thrown will return to thrower
easy.bottlecap: a cap that seals a bottle
easy.bowtie: a man's tie that ties in a bow
easy.bracelet: jewelry worn around the wrist for decoration
easy.brain: that part of the central nervous system that includes all the higher nervous centers; enclosed within the skull; continuous with the spinal cord
easy.bread: food made from dough of flour or meal and usually raised with yeast or baking powder and then baked
easy.bridge: any of various card games based on whist for four players
easy.broom: a cleaning implement for sweeping; bundle of straws or twigs attached to a long handle
easy.bucket: a roughly cylindrical vessel that is open at the top
easy.bush: not of the highest quality or sophistication
easy.butterfly: a swimming stroke in which the arms are thrown forward together out of the water while the feet kick up and down
easy.cactus: any succulent plant of the family Cactaceae native chiefly to arid regions of the New World and usually having spines
easy.cake: a block of solid substance (such as soap or wax)
easy.calculator: a small machine that is used for mathematical calculations
easy.candle: stick of wax with a wick in the middle
easy.cannon: lower part of the leg extending from the hock to the fetlock in hoofed mammals
easy.canoe: small and light boat; pointed at both ends; propelled with a paddle
easy.car: a motor vehicle with four wheels; usually propelled by an internal combustion engine
easy.carrot: promise of reward as in "carrot and stick"
easy.castle: interchanging the positions of the king and a rook
easy.cat: feline mammal usually having thick soft fur and no ability to roar: domestic cats; wildcats
easy.chair: a seat for one person, with a support for the back
easy.chandelier: branched lighting fixture; often ornate; hangs from the ceiling
easy.clock: a timepiece that shows the time of day
easy.cloud: a visible mass of water or ice particles suspended at a considerable altitude
easy.crown: the part of a hat (the vertex) that covers the crown of the head
easy.diamond: a playing card in the minor suit that has one or more red rhombuses on it
easy.door: a swinging or sliding barrier that will close the entrance to a room or building or vehicle
easy.duck: small wild or domesticated web-footed broad-billed swimming bird usually having a depressed body and short legs
easy.dumbbell: an exercising weight; two spheres connected by a short bar that serves as a handle
easy.ear: the sense organ for hearing and equilibrium
easy.eye: a small hole or loop (as in a needle)
easy.face: a vertical surface of a building or cliff
easy.fan: a device for creating a current of air by movement of a surface or surfaces
easy.feather: turning an oar parallel to the water between pulls
easy.finger: one of the parts of a glove that provides covering for a finger or thumb
easy.fireplace: an open recess in a wall at the base of a chimney where a fire can be built
easy.fish: any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills
easy.flashlight: a small portable battery-powered electric lamp
easy.flower: reproductive organ of angiosperm plants especially one having showy or colorful parts
easy.fork: cutlery used for serving and eating food
easy.giraffe: tallest living quadruped; having a spotted coat and small horns and very long neck and legs; of savannahs of tropical Africa
easy.grass: German writer of novels and poetry and plays (born 1927)
easy.guitar: a stringed instrument usually having six strings; played by strumming or plucking
easy.hamburger: a sandwich consisting of a fried cake of minced beef served on a bun, often with other ingredients
easy.hammer: the act of pounding (delivering repeated heavy blows)
easy.harp: a chordophone that has a triangular frame consisting of a sounding board and a pillar and a curved neck; the strings stretched between the neck and the soundbox are plucked with the fingers
easy.hat: an informal term for a person's role
easy.helicopter: an aircraft without wings that obtains its lift from the rotation of overhead blades
easy.hourglass: a sandglass that runs for sixty minutes
easy.house: play in which children take the roles of father or mother or children and pretend to interact like adults
easy.keyboard: holder consisting of an arrangement of hooks on which keys or locks can be hung
easy.knife: edge tool used as a cutting instrument; has a pointed blade with a sharp edge and a handle
easy.ladder: steps consisting of two parallel members connected by rungs; for climbing up or down
easy.lantern: light in a transparent protective case
easy.leaf: hinged or detachable flat section (as of a table or door)
easy.lightning: the flash of light that accompanies an electric discharge in the atmosphere (or something resembling such a flash); can scintillate for a second or more
easy.mailbox: a private box for delivery of mail
easy.microphone: device for converting sound waves into electrical energy
easy.moon: any natural satellite of a planet
easy.nose: a front that resembles a human nose (especially the front of an aircraft)
easy.paintbrush: a brush used as an applicator (to apply paint)
easy.peanut: of little importance or influence or power; of minor status
easy.pear: sweet juicy gritty-textured fruit available in many varieties
easy.pencil: a thin cylindrical pointed writing implement; a rod of marking substance encased in wood
easy.pig: a crude block of metal (lead or iron) poured from a smelting furnace
easy.pillow: a cushion to support the head of a sleeping person
easy.pineapple: large sweet fleshy tropical fruit with a terminal tuft of stiff leaves; widely cultivated
easy.pizza: Italian open pie made of thin bread dough spread with a spiced mixture of e.g. tomato sauce and cheese
easy.rabbit: any of various burrowing animals of the family Leporidae having long ears and short tails; some domesticated and raised for pets or food
easy.scissors: a gymnastic exercise performed on the pommel horse when the gymnast moves his legs as the blades of scissors move
easy.scorpion: arachnid of warm dry regions having a long segmented tail ending in a venomous sting
easy.screwdriver: a hand tool for driving screws; has a tip that fits into the head of a screw
easy.sheep: woolly usually horned ruminant mammal related to the goat
easy.shoe: footwear shaped to fit the foot (below the ankle) with a flexible upper of leather or plastic and a sole and heel of heavier material
easy.shovel: a hand tool for lifting loose material; consists of a curved container or scoop and a handle
easy.skateboard: a board with wheels that is ridden in a standing or crouching position and propelled by foot
easy.skull: the bony skeleton of the head of vertebrates
easy.snail: freshwater or marine or terrestrial gastropod mollusk usually having an external enclosing spiral shell
easy.snake: limbless scaly elongate reptile; some are venomous
easy.snowman: a figure of a person made of packed snow
easy.stairs: a flight of stairs or a flight of steps
easy.star: indicating the most important performer or role
easy.sun: a typical star that is the source of light and heat for the planets in the solar system
easy.swan: stately heavy-bodied aquatic bird with very long neck and usually white plumage as adult
easy.sword: a cutting or thrusting weapon that has a long metal blade and a hilt with a hand guard
easy.syringe: a medical instrument used to inject or withdraw fluids
easy.table: a piece of furniture having a smooth flat top that is usually supported by one or more vertical legs
easy.teapot: pot for brewing tea; usually has a spout and handle
easy.teddy-bear: plaything consisting of a child's toy bear (usually plush and stuffed with soft materials)
easy.telephone: electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds
easy.television: a telecommunication system that transmits images of objects (stationary or moving) between distant points
easy.tent: a portable shelter (usually of canvas stretched over supporting poles and fastened to the ground with ropes and pegs)
easy.toothbrush: small brush; has long handle; used to clean teeth
easy.tornado: a localized and violently destructive windstorm occurring over land characterized by a funnel-shaped cloud extending toward the ground
easy.tree: English actor and theatrical producer noted for his lavish productions of Shakespeare (1853-1917)
easy.triangle: a percussion instrument consisting of a metal bar bent in the shape of an open triangle
easy.umbrella: covering or applying simultaneously to a number of similar items or elements or groups
easy.vase: an open jar of glass or porcelain used as an ornament or to hold flowers
easy.wheel: a simple machine consisting of a circular frame with spokes (or a solid disc) that can rotate on a shaft or axle (as in vehicles or other machines)
easy.windmill: generator that extracts usable energy from winds

medium.ambulance: a vehicle that takes people to and from hospitals
medium.angel: the highest waterfall; has more than one leap; flow varies seasonally
medium.arm: the part of an armchair or sofa that supports the elbow and forearm of a seated person
medium.bandage: a piece of soft material that covers and protects an injured part of the body
medium.basket: a score in basketball made by throwing the ball through the hoop
medium.bat: (baseball) a turn trying to get a hit
medium.bathtub: a relatively large open container that you fill with water and use to wash the body
medium.bear: massive plantigrade carnivorous or omnivorous mammals with long shaggy coats and strong claws
medium.beard: hairy growth on or near the face of certain mammals
medium.bulldozer: large powerful tractor; a large blade in front flattens areas of ground
medium.bus: a vehicle carrying many passengers; used for public transport
medium.calendar: a list or register of events (appointments or social events or court cases etc)
medium.camel: cud-chewing mammal used as a draft or saddle animal in desert regions
medium.camera: equipment for taking photographs (usually consisting of a lightproof box with a lens at one end and light-sensitive film at the other)
medium.campfire: a small outdoor fire for warmth or cooking (as at a camp)
medium.church: a place for public (especially Christian) worship
medium.computer: a machine for performing calculations automatically
medium.cookie: a short line of text that a web site puts on your computer's hard drive when you access the web site
medium.couch: a narrow bed on which a patient lies during psychiatric or psychoanalytic treatment
medium.cow: mature female of mammals of which the male is called `bull'
medium.crab: a stroke of the oar that either misses the water or digs too deeply
medium.crayon: writing implement consisting of a colored stick of composition wax used for writing and drawing
medium.crocodile: large voracious aquatic reptile having a long snout with massive jaws and sharp teeth and a body covered with bony plates; of sluggish tropical waters
medium.cup: a small open container usually used for drinking; usually has a handle
medium.dog: a member of the genus Canis (probably descended from the common wolf) that has been domesticated by man since prehistoric times; occurs in many breeds
medium.dolphin: any of various small toothed whales with a beaklike snout; larger than porpoises
medium.dragon: any of several small tropical Asian lizards capable of gliding by spreading winglike membranes on each side of the body
medium.drill: (military) the training of soldiers to march (as in ceremonial parades) or to perform the manual of arms
medium.elbow: the joint of a mammal or bird that corresponds to the human elbow
medium.eraser: an implement used to erase something
medium.eyeglasses: optical instrument consisting of a pair of lenses for correcting defective vision
medium.fence: a barrier that serves to enclose an area
medium.frog: any of various tailless stout-bodied amphibians with long hind limbs for leaping; semiaquatic and terrestrial species
medium.hedgehog: small nocturnal Old World mammal covered with both hair and protective spines
medium.horse: solid-hoofed herbivorous quadruped domesticated since prehistoric times
medium.hurricane: a severe tropical cyclone usually with heavy rains and winds moving a 73-136 knots (12 on the Beaufort scale)
medium.kangaroo: any of several herbivorous leaping marsupials of Australia and New Guinea having large powerful hind legs and a long thick tail
medium.knee: the part of a trouser leg that provides the cloth covering for the knee
medium.leg: (nautical) the distance traveled by a sailing vessel on a single tack
medium.lighter: a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires
medium.lighthouse: a tower with a light that gives warning of shoals to passing ships
medium.lion: large gregarious predatory feline of Africa and India having a tawny coat with a shaggy mane in the male
medium.lipstick: makeup that is used to color the lips
medium.lobster: any of several edible marine crustaceans of the families Homaridae and Nephropsidae and Palinuridae
medium.map: a diagrammatic representation of the earth's surface (or part of it)
medium.marker: some conspicuous object used to distinguish or mark something
medium.megaphone: a cone-shaped acoustic device held to the mouth to intensify and direct the human voice
medium.mermaid: half woman and half fish; lives in the sea
medium.monkey: any of various long-tailed primates (excluding the prosimians)
medium.mosquito: two-winged insect whose female has a long proboscis to pierce the skin and suck the blood of humans and animals
medium.motorbike: small motorcycle with a low frame and small wheels and elevated handlebars
medium.mountain: a land mass that projects well above its surroundings; higher than a hill
medium.mouse: any of numerous small rodents typically resembling diminutive rats having pointed snouts and small ears on elongated bodies with slender usually hairless tails
medium.moustache: an unshaved growth of hair on the upper lip
medium.mouth: the opening of a jar or bottle
medium.mushroom: fleshy body of any of numerous edible fungi
medium.nail: a thin pointed piece of metal that is hammered into materials as a fastener
medium.necklace: jewelry consisting of a cord or chain (often bearing gems) worn about the neck as an ornament (especially by women)
medium.octopus: bottom-living cephalopod having a soft oval body with eight long tentacles
medium.panda: reddish-brown Old World raccoon-like carnivore; in some classifications considered unrelated to the giant pandas
medium.parachute: rescue equipment consisting of a device that fills with air and retards your fall
medium.parrot: usually brightly colored zygodactyl tropical birds with short hooked beaks and the ability to mimic sounds
medium.penguin: short-legged flightless birds of cold southern especially Antarctic regions having webbed feet and wings modified as flippers
medium.piano: used chiefly as a direction or description in music
medium.pliers: a gripping hand tool with two hinged arms and (usually) serrated jaws
medium.pool: any of various games played on a pool table having 6 pockets
medium.popsicle: ice cream or water ice on a small wooden stick
medium.postcard: a card for sending messages by post without an envelope
medium.potato: an edible tuber native to South America; a staple food of Ireland
medium.purse: a small bag for carrying money
medium.raccoon: an omnivorous nocturnal mammal native to North America and Central America
medium.rain: anything happening rapidly or in quick successive
medium.rake: a long-handled tool with a row of teeth at its head; used to move leaves or loosen soil
medium.rhinoceros: massive powerful herbivorous odd-toed ungulate of southeast Asia and Africa having very thick skin and one or two horns on the snout
medium.rifle: a shoulder firearm with a long barrel and a rifled bore
medium.river: a large natural stream of water (larger than a creek)
medium.sandwich: two (or more) slices of bread with a filling between them
medium.saw: hand tool having a toothed blade for cutting
medium.saxophone: a single-reed woodwind with a conical bore
medium.sink: plumbing fixture consisting of a water basin fixed to a wall or floor and having a drainpipe
medium.sock: hosiery consisting of a cloth covering for the foot; worn inside the shoe; reaches to between the ankle and the knee
medium.spider: predatory arachnid that usually has silk-spinning organs at the back end of the body; they spin silk to make cocoons for eggs or traps for prey
medium.spoon: a piece of cutlery with a shallow bowl-shaped container and a handle; used to stir or serve or take up food
medium.tiger: large feline of forests in most of Asia having a tawny coat with black stripes; endangered
medium.toaster: a kitchen appliance (usually electric) for toasting bread
medium.toe: having a toe or toes of a specified kind; often used in combination
medium.toilet: the act of dressing and preparing yourself
medium.toothpaste: a dentifrice in the form of a paste
medium.tractor: a wheeled vehicle with large wheels; used in farming and other applications
medium.train: public transport provided by a line of railway cars coupled together and drawn by a locomotive
medium.trombone: a brass instrument consisting of a long tube whose length can be varied by a U-shaped slide
medium.truck: an automotive vehicle suitable for hauling
medium.trumpet: a brass musical instrument with a brilliant tone; has a narrow tube and a flared bell and is played by means of valves
medium.underwear: undergarment worn next to the skin and under the outer garments
medium.violin: bowed stringed instrument that is the highest member of the violin family; this instrument has four strings and a hollow body and an unfretted fingerboard and is played with a bow
medium.watermelon: large oblong or roundish melon with a hard green rind and sweet watery red or occasionally yellowish pulp
medium.whale: any of the larger cetacean mammals having a streamlined body and breathing through a blowhole on the head
medium.zebra: any of several fleet black-and-white striped African equines
medium.zigzag: having short sharp turns or angles

hard.asparagus: edible young shoots of the asparagus plant
hard.barn: an outlying farm building for storing grain or animal feed and housing farm animals
hard.baseball: a ball game played with a bat and ball between two teams of nine players; teams take turns at bat trying to score runs
hard.basketball: a game played on a court by two opposing teams of 5 players; points are scored by throwing the ball through an elevated horizontal hoop
hard.beach: an area of sand sloping down to the water of a sea or lake
hard.blackberry: large sweet black or very dark purple edible aggregate fruit of any of various bushes of the genus Rubus
hard.blueberry: sweet edible dark-blue berries of either low-growing or high-growing blueberry plants
hard.camouflage: device or stratagem for concealment or deceit
hard.cello: a large stringed instrument; seated player holds it upright while playing
hard.clarinet: a single-reed instrument with a straight tube
hard.flamingo: large pink to scarlet web-footed wading bird with down-bent bill; inhabits brackish lakes
hard.garden: a plot of ground where plants are cultivated
hard.goatee: a small chin beard trimmed to a point; named for its resemblance to a goat's beard
hard.helmet: a protective headgear made of hard material to resist blows
hard.hospital: a health facility where patients receive treatment
hard.jail: a correctional institution used to detain persons who are in the lawful custody of the government (either accused persons awaiting trial or convicted persons serving a sentence)
hard.laptop: a portable computer small enough to use in your lap
hard.microwave: kitchen appliance that cooks food by passing an electromagnetic wave through it; heat results from the absorption of energy by the water molecules in the food
hard.ocean: a large body of water constituting a principal part of the hydrosphere
hard.oven: kitchen appliance used for baking or roasting
hard.owl: nocturnal bird of prey with hawk-like beak and claws and large head with front-facing eyes
hard.passport: a document issued by a country to a citizen allowing that person to travel abroad and re-enter the home country
hard.sailboat: a small sailing vessel; usually with a single mast
hard.shark: any of numerous elongate mostly marine carnivorous fishes with heterocercal caudal fins and tough skin covered with small toothlike scales
hard.skyscraper: a very tall building with many stories
hard.snorkel: air passage provided by a retractable device containing intake and exhaust pipes; permits a submarine to stay submerged for extended periods of time
hard.spreadsheet: a screen-oriented interactive program enabling a user to lay out financial data on the screen
hard.squirrel: a kind of arboreal rodent having a long bushy tail
hard.steak: a slice of meat cut from the fleshy part of an animal or large fish
hard.stereo: designating sound transmission from two sources through two channels
hard.stethoscope: a medical instrument for listening to the sounds generated inside the body
hard.streetlight: a lamp supported on a lamppost; for illuminating a street
hard.submarine: beneath the surface of the sea
hard.suitcase: a portable rectangular container for carrying clothes
hard.sweater: a crocheted or knitted garment covering the upper part of the body
hard.van: a truck with an enclosed cargo space
hard.wristwatch: a watch that is worn strapped to the wrist
hard.yoga: a system of exercises practiced as part of the Hindu discipline to promote control of the body and mind
